abstract: The aerospace giant Pratt & Whitney has agreed to pay $1.5 billion for Rolls Royce's stake in International Aero Engines, a joint venture that builds engines for Airbus A320 planes.
snippet: The aerospace giant Pratt & Whitney has agreed to pay $1.5 billion for Rolls Royce's stake in International Aero Engines, a joint venture that builds engines for Airbus A320 planes.

headline.main: Pratt & Whitney to Buy Rolls Royce's Stake in Joint Venture
